title: Titan of terror: The dark imagination of H.P. Lovecraft - Silvia Moreno-Garc√≠a

multiple-choice.question: Where was Howard Phillips Lovecraft born?
Which authors' Gothic horror stories did Lovecraft admire?

options.label: A
options.text: Edgar Allan Poe and H.P. Blavatsky

options.label: C
options.text: Edgar Allan Poe and Robert Chambers

options.label: D
options.text: Mary Shelley and Robert Louis Stevenson

multiple-choice.question: What was the impact of World War I on the arts, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: It led to an increased interest in fantastical folklore.

options.label: B
options.text: It had no significant impact on the arts.

options.label: C
options.text: It cast a long shadow over the arts, making people less frightened of fantastical folklore.

options.label: D
options.text: It led to a decline in the popularity of horror stories.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the shared universe created by Lovecraft and his contemporaries?
What is the characteristic of Lovecraftian horror, according to the transcript?

options.label: C
options.text: The terror lies in what's not directly portrayed, but left to the imagination

options.label: D
options.text: The use of scientific elements to explain supernatural phenomena

multiple-choice.question: Who are the Great Old Ones in Lovecraft's fiction?

options.label: B
options.text: Primordial forces that lurk at the corners of reality

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of Yog-Sothoth in Lovecraft's fiction?

options.label: A
options.text: A powerful deity with a clear motivation

options.label: B
options.text: A primordial force that froths as primal slime in nuclear chaos

options.label: C
options.text: A supernatural creature with magical powers

options.label: D
options.text: A human character who uncovers the secrets of the Great Old Ones

multiple-choice.question: How did Lovecraft's personal views affect his work?

options.label: A
options.text: His racist views had no impact on his writing

options.label: B
options.text: His racist views are reflected in some of his works, including crude stereotypes and slurs

options.label: C
options.text: His racist views are implicit in his writing, but not explicitly stated

options.label: D
options.text: His racist views are a central theme in his work

multiple-choice.question: What was Lovecraft's financial situation at the time of his death?

options.label: B
options.text: He was struggling financially, but had a steady income

options.label: D
options.text: He had a modest income from his writing

multiple-choice.question: What is the enduring legacy of Lovecraft's work, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: His work has been largely forgotten

options.label: B
options.text: His work has inspired numerous adaptations and reinterpretations

options.label: C
options.text: His work has had a limited impact on popular culture

options.label: D
options.text: His work is only remembered for its racist themes

title: The hidden network that makes the internet possible - Sajan Saini

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary material used in fiber optic cables to transmit data?
What phenomenon allows light to travel within glass fiber optic cables?
What is the main advantage of using fiber optic signals over electricity or radio signals?
What is the term for the practice of storing and processing data in remote servers accessed through the internet?
What is the primary problem associated with traditional electrical cables in data centers?
What technology has come to the rescue to address the limitations of fiber optics in cloud and mobile computing?
What is the primary benefit of using photonic chips in data centers?

options.label: C
options.text: Reduced heat waste and power consumption

multiple-choice.question: What is the main challenge associated with using terahertz frequencies for wireless communication?

options.label: B
options.text: Limited range and absorption by moisture

multiple-choice.question: How can photonic chips help address the limitations of wireless bandwidth?

options.label: A
options.text: By increasing the power of wireless signals

options.label: B
options.text: By using terahertz frequencies and relaying signals over optical fiber

options.label: C
options.text: By reducing the number of wireless devices

multiple-choice.question: What is the ultimate goal of using integrated photonics and fiber optics in communication systems?

options.label: C
options.text: To enable hyperfast wireless connectivity and build a more expansive virtual world

options.label: D
options.text: To reduce power consumption in data centers
